content: mastectomy/top surgery recovery pillow - free crochet pattern by dee m on ravelry published june 17 2024 this pattern is free to use and share but please do not sell it thank you materials 6 mm size j crochet hook two balls of bernat® blanket super bulky 6 100% polyester or equivalent ● each ball is 10 5 oz/300 g 220 yds/201 m ● swatch is 7 single_crochet x 8 r = 4x4 in/10x10 cm with 8 mm size l hook ● example pillow is in pow purple from the brights collection fiberfill or stuffing alternative yard needle or smaller crochet hook for seaming and weaving in ends scissors pattern notes this pattern consists of several panels ● half arm panels you will crochet 8 total each half panel should be 13 in 33 cm tall and 6 5 in 16 5 cm wide ● full arm panels you will assemble 2 half arm panels to create a full arm panel each full arm panel should be 13 in 33 cm tall and 11 in 27 9 cm wide ● middle panels you will crochet 2 total each middle panel should be 13 in 33 cm tall and 5 in 12 7 cm wide ● full panels you will assemble 2 full arm panels and 1 middle panel to create a full panel each full panel should be 13 in 33 cm tall and 27 in 68 5 cm wide you will have two identical full panels that you will stitch together and stuff at the end to create a pillow you can stuff the pillow as loose or as firm as is comfortable to you and the amount of stuffing will determine the depth of the pillow avoid over-stuffing you will want the pillow to wrap slightly around your chest the final dimensions should be 13 in 33 cm tall and 27 in 68 5 cm wide except for the final seam after stuffing always seam on the same side when assembling panels and keep seams on the inside of the pillow at the end size adjustments the scoops on either side of the pillow should fit comfortably under your armpits if you would like the pillow to be longer to accommodate a wider torso add row to the middle panels marked below with single asterisks conversely to make the pillow shorter for a narrower torso include fewer row in the middle pane marked below with single asterisks if you would like the arm holes to be larger add row at the end of the half arm panels marked below with single asterisks conversely it is possible to omit row in the half arm panels to make the arm holes slightly smaller marked below with single asterisks to make the pillow taller i e for a longer torso or shorter i e for a shorter torso adjust the number of starting chains by 2 and adjust the stitches accordingly for example if you increase the number of starting chains
